result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A Carle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
First 6 months with Huber privileges for work and treatment, last 6 months with same Huber privilegs PLUS release to Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any sentence

miscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Random urine screens. No positive results. No illegal drugs. Maintain absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without valid prescription. No contact with drug community.
Seek and maintain full time employment. Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

timeConds.notes: 1ST MONTH TO BE SERVED FORTHWITH, with Huber privileges for work and treatment. The last 3 months imposed and STAYED to be used by agent for violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith A Carle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation granted, signed and filed
Intake Routing Face Sheet via email, received and filed
Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation 973.09(3)(d), received and filed. LNR
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carolina Stark, Branch 17, calendar successor, for review. mag
PROBATION EARLY DISCHARGE RECOMMENDATION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO JUNE S. OS
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $562 entered as ordered by the court on 09/22/14 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 04/01/15. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Defendant Keith A Carle in court with attorney Jodi Andrea Sanfelippo.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 2 days served; first 6 months with Huber privileges for work and treatment, last 6 months with same Huber privilegs PLUS release to Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring. The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 
years with the following conditions:
*Court ordered condition time of 4 months in the HOC, 1st month to be served forthwith with Huber privileges for work and treatment, last 3 months imposed and STAYED to be used by agent for violations.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Keith A Carle in court with attorney Jodi A Sanfelippo.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the Safety Bldg.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Keith A Carle in court with attorney Jodi A Sanfelippo.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keith A Carle in court.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's petition for appointment of counsel GRANTED by the court.  Court appointed Attorney Sanfelippo as counsel of record.  Written order received and filed.  Case passed.

Defendant Keith A Carle in court.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Court is advised by attoirney Melissa Fitzsimmons that the defendant is NOT public defender eligible,  Court finds that appointment of counse is required and that the defendant has the ability to repay the county at a rate of $100.00 per month.  Message was left for attorney Jodi SanFellipo reguarding this case.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 26,  Status conference scheduled for 05-30-2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicasted Driver Intervention Program report dated 05-19-14 received and filed.

Defendant Keith A Carle in court.  Joy Hammond for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears without counsel.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  
  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 5/12/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keith A Carle in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Keith A Carle in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY NOT BE ELIGIBLE FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION DUE TO EMPLOYMENT.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
